args.natural_language_statement: Let f : R^n -> R be differentiable and H_f is continuous on a convex set U. Show that f(x+h) = f(x) + ‚àáf(x)¬∑h + 1/2 h^T H_f(x) h + o(‚Äñh‚Äñ^2) as h -> 0 uniformly on compact subsets of U.

retrieved_examples.nl: If f : R^n -> R is C^2 on a convex set U, then f(x+h)=f(x)+‚àáf(x)¬∑h+1/2 h^T Hess f(x) h+o(‚Äñh‚Äñ^2) uniformly on compacts.
retrieved_examples.lean:
import Mathlib

theorem taylor_2_uniform_on_compacts {n : ‚Ñï} {U : Set (Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù)} (f : (Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù) ‚Üí ‚Ñù)
  (hess_cont : ContinuousOn (hessian f) U) (hdiff : DifferentiableOn ‚Ñù f U) (U_convex : Convex U) :
  ‚àÄ K, IsCompact K ‚Üí K ‚äÜ U ‚Üí ‚àÄ x ‚àà K, (fun h => f (x + h) - f x - (deriv f x).toLinearMap h - 1/2 * h·µÄ (hessian f x) h) = o(Œª h => ‚Äñh‚Äñ^2) := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib
open Set Fin Filter Function
open scoped NNReal Topology

/-- Let f : R^n -> R be differentiable and H_f is continuous on a convex set U. Show that f(x+h) = f(x) + ‚àáf(x)¬∑h + 1/2 h^T H_f(x) h + o(‚Äñh‚Äñ^2) as h -> 0 uniformly on compact subsets of U. -/
theorem taylor_2_uniform_on_compacts {n : ‚Ñï} {U : Set (Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù)} (f : (Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù) ‚Üí ‚Ñù)
  (hess_cont : ContinuousOn (hessian f) U) (hdiff : DifferentiableOn ‚Ñù f U) (U_convex : Convex U) :
  ‚àÄ K, IsCompact K ‚Üí K ‚äÜ U ‚Üí ‚àÄ x ‚àà K, (fun h => f (x + h) - f x - (deriv f x).toLinearMap h - 1/2 * h·µÄ (hessian f x) h) = o(Œª h => ‚Äñh‚Äñ^2) := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Let f : ‚Ñù^n ‚Üí ‚Ñù be differentiable and the second derivative (as an iterated Fr√©chet derivative)
    is continuous on a convex set U. Then Taylor's expansion up to second order holds with a
    uniform little-o(‚Äñh‚Äñ^2) remainder on compact subsets of U. -/
theorem taylor_2_uniform_on_compacts {n : ‚Ñï} {U : Set (Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù)} (f : (Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù) ‚Üí ‚Ñù)
  (hdiff : DifferentiableOn ‚Ñù f U) (hess_cont : ContinuousOn (fun x => iteratedFDeriv 2 f x) U)
  (U_convex : Convex U) :
  ‚àÄ K : Set (Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù), IsCompact K ‚Üí K ‚äÜ U ‚Üí
    ‚àÄ Œµ : ‚Ñù, 0 < Œµ ‚Üí ‚àÉ Œ¥ : ‚Ñù, 0 < Œ¥ ‚àß
      ‚àÄ x ‚àà K, ‚àÄ h : Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù, ‚Äñh‚Äñ < Œ¥ ‚Üí x + h ‚àà U ‚Üí
        |f (x + h) - f x - (fderiv ‚Ñù f x : (Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù) ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] ‚Ñù) h - (1 / 2) * (iteratedFDeriv 2 f x) fun _ => h| ‚â§ Œµ * ‚Äñh‚Äñ ^ 2 := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Let f : ‚Ñù^n ‚Üí ‚Ñù be differentiable and the second derivative (as an iterated Fr√©chet derivative)
    is continuous on a convex set U. Then Taylor's expansion up to second order holds with a
    uniform little-o(‚Äñh‚Äñ^2) remainder on compact subsets of U. -/
theorem taylor_2_uniform_on_compacts {n : ‚Ñï} {U : Set (Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù)} (f : (Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù) ‚Üí ‚Ñù)
  (hdiff : DifferentiableOn ‚Ñù f U) (hess_cont : ContinuousOn (fun x => iteratedFDeriv (2 : ‚Ñï) f x) U)
  (U_convex : Convex ‚Ñù U) :
  ‚àÄ K : Set (Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù), IsCompact K ‚Üí K ‚äÜ U ‚Üí
    ‚àÄ Œµ : ‚Ñù, 0 < Œµ ‚Üí ‚àÉ Œ¥ : ‚Ñù, 0 < Œ¥ ‚àß
      ‚àÄ x ‚àà K, ‚àÄ h : Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù, ‚Äñh‚Äñ < Œ¥ ‚Üí x + h ‚àà U ‚Üí
        |f (x + h) - f x - (fderiv ‚Ñù f x) h - (1 / 2 : ‚Ñù) * (iteratedFDeriv (2 : ‚Ñï) f x) fun _ => h| ‚â§ Œµ * ‚Äñh‚Äñ ^ 2 := by sorry

import Mathlib

/-- Let f : ‚Ñù^n ‚Üí ‚Ñù be differentiable and the second derivative (as an iterated Fr√©chet derivative)
    is continuous on a convex set U. Then Taylor's expansion up to second order holds with a
    uniform little-o(‚Äñh‚Äñ^2) remainder on compact subsets of U. -/
theorem taylor_2_uniform_on_compacts {n : ‚Ñï} {U : Set (Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù)} (f : (Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù) ‚Üí ‚Ñù)
  (hdiff : DifferentiableOn ‚Ñù f U) (hess_cont : ContinuousOn (fun x => iteratedFDeriv ‚Ñù 2 f x) U)
  (U_convex : Convex ‚Ñù U) :
  ‚àÄ K : Set (Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù), IsCompact K ‚Üí K ‚äÜ U ‚Üí
    ‚àÄ Œµ : ‚Ñù, 0 < Œµ ‚Üí ‚àÉ Œ¥ : ‚Ñù, 0 < Œ¥ ‚àß
      ‚àÄ x ‚àà K, ‚àÄ h : Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù, ‚Äñh‚Äñ < Œ¥ ‚Üí x + h ‚àà U ‚Üí
        |f (x + h) - f x - (fderiv ‚Ñù f x : (Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù) ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] ‚Ñù) h - (1 / 2 : ‚Ñù) * (iteratedFDeriv ‚Ñù 2 f x) fun _ => h| ‚â§ Œµ * ‚Äñh‚Äñ ^ 2 := by sorry
